name: Dangers  "Messy, Isn't It?" CD
description: Sarcastic and menially insightful, Dangers poke at the foundation of hardcore lyrically while playing a chaotic form of hardcore that is all over the map in terms of speed, heaviness and melody. This is the CD version of the CD/LP pressed in the US. This version is from Australia.

name: Edhochuli S/T LP
description:
Pittsburgh's sons have been once described as "THIN LIZZY but with more weed!" 

Catch them on the road soon w Moxiebeat

name: Edhochuli/Waste Age 10" Split
description:
Edhochuli: 1) If You Thought That Was Sweet, Check This Out

Waste Age: 1) Lion's Den 2) Infinite Repeat

Artwork by Fritz Aragon. Mastered by JJ Golden at Golden Mastering.

"Fresh off just releasing a full length, Edhochuli return to deliver a track that blows everything away (again). Waste Age round up the record delivering two amazing songs." - Nuestra Lengua Records

"Hailing from Orange County, this recently formed quartet packs melodic guitar lines, math-y compositions and strong lead vocals that pack both an intellectual and emotional punch. Calling to mind a warmer and more guttural version of Menomena, Waste Age's musical chops and songwriting talent shine through their new split 10" with Edhochuli and they look like a band on the rise." - Ian, Origami Vinyl

name: Lord Snow "Solitude" LP
description: It might took almost one year til we got everything together -  Lord Snow hailing from Chicago, IL  feat. peeps from Suffix, Raw Nerve and other bands. LORD SNOW deliver 12 songs of chaotic fast screaming hardcore. Straight distorted and passionate w/ female vocals. In your face and gonna leave your there w/ bloody ears and a disturbed mind.

name: Static Me "S/T" LP
description: import on Adagio830

name: Negative Standards/Whitehorse Split LP
description: Negistan from Oakland rip, featuring members of Reivers and Acts of Sedition. Must peep material.

name: Vyst "try again, fail again..." LP
description: Thrashy stuff from germany featuring members of Perth Express.

name: Deadverse "Carpet Burns" LP
description: This is the new LP from Swiss rippers Deadverse. A solid mix of Hot Snakes and Dischord, don't not check this out.

name: Mourning Cloak "No Visible Light" LP
description: This is the first LP release from North Carolina's Mourning Cloak. With members of Graf Orlock, Torchbearer and others, this doomy sludge will make your brain hurt. Peep it asap.

name: Hoax "Collected" LP
description: All types of stuff before their latest LP. Pist.

name: Holy "the Age of Collapse" LP
description: Ragers from Milano, pick this up, see them live, punch yourself in the face, this record rips. Import.

name: Death Hymn Number 9 3rd Degree Moonburns Shirt
description: Get this, or you will not be respected in your local high-school, AA, or religious community group, perhaps a combination of those three would better describe your social circle. Good luck.

name: Bone Dance "S/T" Lp
description:
Bone Dance takes the grime and gravelly glut of the band’s previous work, the self-released Snakecharmers, and reevaluates not only its intensity, but also the band’s heritage: retooling the ferocity of hardcore, the technical acumen of extreme metal, and the minimal gauze of sludge and doom. This is the kind of tight, controlled, anvil-heavy music that only comes out of an area dominated by the Religious Right, the Conservative Coalition, and some of the most culturally repressive mechanisms in America.

from melotov records

name: Bone Dance "Snakecharmers" LP
description:
200 dank green/smoke haze, 300 gold single-sided 12"; digital download

This repress offers completely new artwork,

Released in 2010 and out of print shortly thereafter, "Snakecharmers" was the EP that put Bone Dance on the map amongst the ranks of Gaza, Coalesce, or Engineer. Self-described as "utter, desert-driven nihilism" the quintet from Boise, Idaho (although not a desert) deliver a relentless barrage of start/stop grindy, mathy, hardcore chaos and don't let up

name: Protestant "Reclamation" LP
description:
Black vinyl
Matte Finish Covers 
11×11 insert.
download card.

5 songs. 20 min.
dark fucking hardcore punk.

name: Light Bearer "Lapsus" 2 x LP
description:
Lightbearer is a concept band from the south east of England. Bringing together long standing friends and new allies in an attempt to create a musical project, mixing their love of ambient post rock, post metal, beats, noise and experimental soundscapes. The concept itself borrows from The His Dark Materials trilogy by Philip Pullman, Paradise Lost by John Milton and The Divine Comedy by Dante Alighieri. For Fans of Envy, Sigur Ros, Aphex Twin, Mouth Of The Architect, 65 Days Of Static, and Neurosis!

Former members of Fall of Efrafa

black 180gram vinyl. gatefold. truly sick

From Halo of Flies

.

name: Light Bearer "Silver Tongue" 2 x LP
description:
The 2nd full length after the “Lapsus” DLP, “Beyond the Infinite” EP and the Split LP with Northless.
Nearly 80minutes of post rock influenced doom metal with sludgy heavy hardcore at its well developed core.

“This album is intimidating. It is so fucking good, I don’t even know where to start.” – Iron Hops

US PRESSING
500 copies. 180 gram vinyl.
200 black.
Heavyweight Full Color Reverse Board Gatefold covers,
full color printed inner sleeves,
2 12inch full color art inserts (of images on the inner sleeves),
and a download card.

name: Jungbluth "Partache" LP
description:
This is the new release LP from these dudes from Muenster. ex Alpinist members unleash a fury of a debut Lp dark political hardcore from germany. the best possible combination.

Black, 9 inserts. Badass.

name: GRAF ORLOCK "Nicholas Cage: One of our finest Actors" Shirt
description:
Finally, a shirt that represents the finest in American thespians, while at the same time pointing out all of the amazing roles Cage had to take on to handle a sizable pointless debt and to push his career even further into the absurd. Such notable images here are the wicker man bee torture mask and various questionable haircuts from national treasure. Enjoy

Multicolor front

name: GRAF ORLOCK "Save Animals Not Humans" Shirt
description:
Lots of discussion exists about the relationship between man and other species. This takes that discussion to its illogical extreme and posits: save animals and shoot humans in the face. No one but Steven Seagal could be a better spokesman, with his commitment to the environment, inaccurate claims to his native american bloodline, and part-time cop. Wear with pride as you engender conversations you don't want to have.

Front print, back label print

name: GRAF ORLOCK "HXC" SHIRT
description:
Duh this shirt is awesome. Reminds you of that time you went back to the 50's and almost unscrupulously made it with your own mother. Wow that would have been an "incident" in the space time continuum. Lucky you. Keep chilling with that methhead Doc Brown and see what happens. 

Badass front and back print

name: GRAF ORLOCK Jurassic Park "No Fences No Borders" Shirt
description:
Voice your outrage at respective borders and annoying pig officials with this fantastic new shirt, released just in time for Jurassic Park 3d. Reprinted in all unimportant sizes.

Front lots of colors print, back label logo print

name: Adult Books Tape
description: 6 song tape (including the 4 on the 7" that just came out), pressed on Lolipop Records. These are an excellent set of songs. Better check this out asap, or be that one asshole later on down the road that nods about being into a band when you aren't and all of your other stupid friends are. This shit is sweet. Peep it here.

name: Griever/At Our Heels/Vygr 3-Way Split LP
description:
This three-way split features three tracks each from Boston, MA's VYGR who take cues from Neurosis and Old Man Gloom, the Bay Area's At Our Heels who play modern hardcore in the vein of HopeCon, and San Diego, CA's Griever who feature ex-members of Lewd Acts. LP includes digital download. Look for the new Griever full length coming soon, or check out their 2011 10" Inferior in the webstore. 

1. 	 VYGR - Starvation
2. 	 VYGR - The Iron Furnace
3. 	 VYGR - Mescaline Hymn
4. 	 At Our Heels - Rosary
5. 	 At Our Heels - Seizures
6. 	 At Our Heels - Tourist
7. 	 Griever - What Once Was (Lost)
8. 	 Griever - Serpent Song
9. 	 Griever - King Of Ash

name: Regulations "Different Needs" 7"
description:
Four new tracks for 2007 from Regulations. An outstanding mix of the sounds of late 70's Swedish punk with the early LA scene. At first listen you hear the influence of the Germs and early Black Flag, but more structured and complex guitar work and arrangements on this release show that beneath the sneering raw hardcore punk is a more cerebral approach to hardcore song writing based on the 70's Svensk Punk sound. 

TRACK LISTING

Different Needs/My Circle// Cat Eyes/New Ways

name: Dangers Speak Less shirt $8 XL ONLY
description: Some remaining from tour, suggesting we should take our own advice

name: Dangers Euro Tour Shirt 2013 $10
description:
This shirt is siqq and funny and apparently no one else agrees. Anyway, you get the nice crying eagle (which is a great leitmotif these days), a flag in a toilet and some other real fun stuff about borders and politics, etc. 

Anyways, got some left, buy this

front and back print w a curious anomaly of having two shows in Cologne (Koeln and Cologne, neither of which were actual shows).

name: Dream Decay "Ferns" LP $7
description:
Seattle's Dreamdecay stumbles, lurches, and crashes through five tracks of carefully-constructed-so-that-it-sounds-clumsy noise rock on "Fern." The whole thing sounds like one long nightmare, in the form of a sustained fight between the drums and guitar. Cool dudes connected with or have also played in Marrow/owen hart stuff, and everything else from up north. 

check out the EP here: https://soundcloud.com/dreamdecay

name: Death Hymn Number 9 "3rd Degree Moonburns" LP
description:
Formed out of the murky Louisiana Swamp, these four denizens of somnambulance and limited brain power were a former backing band to Motown's greats, until abandoned at a routine gas stop in Baton Rouge in August 1965. In an act of brazen post-mortem activity, the band soldiered on, focusing their collective rage and wild abandonment issues into a thrashy, gross, fast, groovy, loud, hurt-feeling-fest of garage and punk rock bravado. After emerging from those garbage laden swamps, the band relocated to Los Angeles in late 2009 to annoy and harass the lazy bourgeois bar going public and teenage backyard house show attendee. Who knows what posthumous ridiculousness will ensue.

14 songs.

name: Ghostlimb/Fischer Split 10" VIT002 ON SALE $6
description:
This 11 song 10" Split is the second Vitriol release, featuring LA's pissed ass Ghostlimb, and the Bay Area's own vitruosos of "going there", Fischer. 6 new songs from Ghostlimb raging on such subjects as the Spanish Civil War, autonomy, and hating you, while Fischer focus on the lighter side of human suffering. Excellent record that I can't stop listening to. Nothing special about this beyond both bands being amazing. 

-Vitriol 002
-150 Brown (pre-orders), 850 Orange

name: DANGERS "MESSY, ISN'T IT?" LP VIT003 Repress
description:
This is the third press of this record, making it an even 2000 in existence. These ones come with the big 6 fold poster, sans cd (cds are worthless, we all know this). So check it out, red vinyl and well worth your shittily wasted allowance money. 


Good night.

name: Robotosaurus - Manhater US Release 10" VIT004
description:
This is  the debut full length from Adelaide, Australia's Robotosaurus, coming out on the eve of their US 2009 tour, this shit kicks up the brutal meter with a healthy does of heavy. 10 inch format, get on this. I am pretty sure I have never met people as perpetually drunk as this, Lewd Acts, get out your notebooks. You can listen to the entire album here:

www.vitriolrecords.com/robotosaurus.html

Pressing Info:
50 blue vinyl
450 yellow vinyl

pic 1: 10"
pic 2: major influence in writing this record

name: Drowning With Our Anchors/Maladie Split 10" VIT007
description:
Finally, this is the 10" Split from these bands from San Francisco and Tijuana. On the heels of their respective full lengths, this record brings a new extended song from DWOA and 3 new songs from Maladie. This contains a full color innersleeve and a double die-cut 10" jacket, and color vinyl. Check this out. 
-On sale Sat June 19th, 12:00 AM
-Preorders are white vinyl, 150/800. (75 Vitriol/75 Glory Kid Records)
-Standard Press is Tan Vinyl 650/800 
-Limit one Pre-order color copy per order. If you order more than one you will receive one Pre-order edition (White) and one standard color copy (Tan).

name: Forming- S/T 7" VIT008
description:
Alright assholes. This thing is finally here, and it is a good ass record. This is 4 songs recorded sometime this year, with what i call a mixture of archers of loaf and dino j, meeting somewhere in a drunken haze in the mid 90s. You are worse off not having this, and it adds a decidedly different and interesting tone to a label hell bent on being pigeon-holed as a shitty hardcore garbage can.

-email me if you want to wholesale these. 
-members of ghostlimb
-This is VIT008

$7 for shipping and record together in the us
outside the us, shipping is more,

name: Comadre/Glasses Split 2x7" VIT009
description:
BTC009/VIT009

Two 7" records on heavy (70-gram) vinyl with a 12-page booklet fixed to the inner spine of a gatefold cover. Split release with Bone's label Bloodtown Records. 

This is Comadre's 6th release and Glasses' 2nd, with both bands following up one-sided LPs released last year. If Comadre's "A Wolf Ticket" had been a full length, these songs would have rounded out the release. Glasses delivers the most pulverising, rock 'n' roll-ing-est hardcore that has ever been played in drop-C tuning. 

Out of 1,000 records pressed, the color variations are as follows:

100 x Clear
300 x Clear w/ Blue Haze
600 x Black & Blue


Track Listing:
COMADRE: the sweeter the juice; byrne'ing down the haus; count basie box set; living differently?!
GLASSES: Tigers; So Right; Lydia.

Pre-Orders start at Midnight on Saturday, May 8th. 

Pre-order this with the Dangers "Anger" Repress and save on shipping/get some cool shit.


these will all be sent out at the same time, roughly around the beginning of june.

name: DANGERS "ANGER" LP VIT010 Repress White Vinyl
description:
-This is VIT010. 

Repress in on white vinyl ftw

name: Earth Control (Owen Hart (VIT011)LP Repress Available Now! (No CD)
description: This is Earth Control's (formerly Owen Hart) proper full length. This shit is metal as all hell. The first press of 500 is all gone, and this repress of the second 500 will be in soon. Get this while they last, first shits went fast! This one does not have a cd with it, because cds are worthless.

name: Graf Orlock "Doombox 10"+Trilogy CD VIT013 (Second Press Red Vinyl)
description:
Alright. Finally this piece of shit is out, featuring a 10" worth of new material based on the complexities of urban disparity, and a cd containing the Doombox 10" songs plus the last three trilogy records. This, I shit you not, is 42 songs of Gorlock madness spanning the last 4 years of mindless wandering through the cinemagrind ether. If you care to look at the image, this comes in a handsome foldout boombox, completing a new staple to your bedroom feng shui, and guaranteeing that you misunderstand what this thing will really look like. The original two pressings were black (150 preorders) and clear (1350 standard press). 

This is the second pressing of 500 which are red. These are in process and will ship in the next few weeks.
-This is VIT013. 

These shits sold out quick, more coming soon!

name: Ghostlimb - Bearing and Distance CD VIT014
description:
This is the complete 14 song version of Bearing and Distance that has been lost for some time due to crashing former labels and finally repressed by yours truly under the auspices good business decisions. Personally one of my favorite records to come out of this mess (throwing objectivity to the wind, naturlich).   

This CD contains both the Bearing and Distance LP songs as well as the 4 songs on the ghostlimb/zann/perth express/trainwreck 4 way split LP. 14 songs in all, this one is perfect for your police academy workout routine, kids listening to ipods in the car while their detached parents try to chat with them about their day, or any long stretch of potential jail time. 

Pic 1. Cover of Cd/Speculative map from the Netherlands from the 1600s and my hope for the future of a strong California economy. 

Pic 2. Wilbur.

name: GHOSTLIMB "INFRASTRUCTURE" LP/Digital Download VIT016
description: Finally, this thing is coming into being. This is the third LP from Ghostlimb and probably the most defined at what we are actually trying to get across/done. Lots of thrashing, melody, and pissed. This has 12 songs and an included digital download card. The jacket is die-cut (see image), with a printed innersleeve, and an embossed back, all on nice 350 gsm cardstock. Preorders go up March 19th (saturday) at 8pm to account for other people not on the west coast to get this. World: time zones are your problem. Proper release April 5th. This first press is 700 lps, 600 black, and 100 of the preorder color, silver. Please check out. Tracks: 1. Construction 2. Concrete 3. Extreme Duress 4. Biota 5. Reduction 6. Asphalt 7. Unending Ache 8. Incomplete Works 9. Traverse 10. Substructure 11. Eight 12. Plastic Surgery

name: Andrew Bonazelli "The Dreamt and Deathless Obscene" Book Standard Edition VIT017
description:
The summer of ’75. The world struggles to endure an affliction that has transformed half its citizenry into frenzied deviants. Major metropolitan areas have been (poorly) quarantined, as the afflicted—and their even more depraved counterparts, the unsound—roam freely. In Philadelphia, a cultish grassroots organization aims to salvage some shred of humanity until a cure is discovered, but its motivations are dubious. No solution is in sight. It’s unclear as to whether anybody even cares anymore.

The Gall family is among the countless irreparably marred by the phenomenon, from embittered patriarch Walter to his sons, one an emotionally absent narcissist, the other foolishly entertaining a pregnancy with his afflicted fiancée. Trapped in a protracted purgatorial transition between societies, the Galls have no recourse but to persevere. Whether that means investigating the malady’s legitimacy, fixating on old regrets or succumbing to gruesome indulgence, all fail to recognize that the differences between their past and lurid present are negligible.

The Dreamt and Deathless Obscene is available in two formats: standard paperback and ultra-limited corpsepile edition. The latter was hand-assembled/stained/screwdrivered/hammered/obliterated by the author and his substantially less degenerate bookmaking associate. Only twenty of these monstrosities exist, perfect for struggling to hold together in a park, tavern or doctor’s office, staring above and mortifying the object of your affection.

Comes out April 5th
Image 1: Corpsepile Limited Edition ($15)
Image 2: Corpsepile
Image 3: Standard Bound Edition ($10)

name: REIVERS "SCHEMATA" 7" VIT018
description: The first 7" release from this Oakland, CA band featuring members of Graf Orlock and Acts of Sedition. Female fronted hardcore in the vein of Suicide File and other rocky-hardcore styles. Check this out. Stamped records and offset press jackets. Boom

name: Griever "Inferior" 10" VIT020
description: This is the first release from the San Diego area's Griever. Former members of Lewd Acts take on a new direction of sometimes drony, sometimes sludgy, but always melodic and well put together. This is 4 songs, equating to a solid 20 minutes of awesome music. This comes in a gatefold 10" jacket with spot varnish and all the bells and whistles of a badass release. Will be mailed out in a few weeks. 75 Black preorders 425 White Standard Press

name: TRAINWRECK "IF THERE'S LIGHT IT WILL FIND YOU" 12" EP VIT021
description:
This is the new Trainwreck 4 song long running 12" EP. Shit is melodic, brutal, a little bit evil, and all together tight. The layout is die-cut on the front, preorder colors are red, standard color is black. Pick these up soon, Trainwreck will be playing around quite a bit in Europe this summer and hopefully will make it back to the US soon. 

Pic 1: Preorder Color
Pic 2: Standard Press

This is out officially June 26th.

name: Birds In Row "Collected" LP VIT023
description: This is a repress of "Rise of the Phoenix" 7"(VIT005) and "Cottbus" LP (VIT015) in grand full length LP fashion. This has a die-cut jacket and a printed inner sleeve in all of its layout majesty. These two records are fucking good, and this LP is even better because it is all in one remastered place. The three-piece from Laval, France is going places and rule hard. Check it out before they are gone. 12 Tracks Side A 1. Among the Ashes (015) 2. Colossus (015) 3. Word of Astaroth (015) 4. Ace of Fools (015) 5. Chat Noir (015) 6. A Kid Called Dreamer (015) 7. Cottbus Outro (015) Side B 1. The Letter (005) 2. Die, Testosterone, Die (005) 3. Orange Disease (005) 4. Actus Fidei (005) 5. Phoenix (005)

name: GRAF ORLOCK "LOS ANGELES" 7"  VIT025 Second Press w/Poster
description: This is the most mind-numbing incarnation of Gorlock, true to form, and a rigid adherence to the annoying doctrine of cinemagrind, this 7" rages through four tracks in 10 minutes (curiously the same running time as the 6 Doombox tracks). Complete with requisite "source information", these songs are faster, more complete, and believe it or not, more pissed. This EP ventures further into the "character study" of Los Angeles, focusing on themes as diverse as stilted relationships, getting robbed, and shooting the shit out of downtown for 11 unimpeded minutes, while simultaneously encapsulating the disgusting culture of the mid-90s. This comes with an insert featuring lyrics and some great artwork courtesy Alan Hunter. There are 600 copies of this bastard, broken down into three different covers. The covers will have actual me-shot bullets holes in them, so technically, each is a 1/1 because even though i have ridiculously accurate and tight firing patterns, no two are the same. For you wieners trolling discogs, they are all black vinyl. Preorders go on March 10, let's say 9pm pacific. Tunes up soon. Karl has been heavily immersed in hip-hop lately, which i believe definitively informs his call-and-response vocal delivery. If you have a problem with this, you should consider the idea of having your friends in a band no matter how braindead they sound. This will be shipped in the coming weeks, proper release date is April 10, but it will be before that. Adieu The Poster is 14"x21" with all of your favorite characters from Heat. The image is also on the "Los Angeles" shirt Side A: 1. Dead Man Talking 2. No Attachments Side B: 3. Couples Seeking Comfort/No Point 4. Quick on the Trigger

name: GHOSTLIMB "CONFLUENCE" LP VIT026 Preorders Up June 2nd 8pm PST
description:
This record is the second in a trilogy from Ghostlimb, starting with last year's "Infrastructure" LP. As a whole, this is the 5th ghostlimb release to date. Confluence takes up where this leaves off and moves the discourse about varying scrutinized topics along with bravado and jerkiness. This Lp has 11 new songs, ranging from regional politics, those piece of shit kids you grew up with, political theory, and ecology. Also featured is a cover of Hot Water Music's "Southeast First". In a never ending effort to die from stress related mortality issues, this record comes out a few months shy of a year after Infrastructure, with a pretty awesome Euro tour between. This LP is die-cut with a printed dust sleeve and heavy cardstock. Digital downloads will be included as well as explanations for all of the lyrical content. 

Preorders go up June 2nd 8pm PST. This is a saturday. 

150 Black preorder LPs
850 White standard LPs

Track listing:
1. Confluence
2. Margins
3. Sunlight
4. Canidae
5. infrastructure
6. Bearing Witness
7. Ardor
8. Control 
9. Exchange
10. Infinite Locality
11. Southeast First
12. Conquerors of the Useless

this is a split release between Vitriol and Melotov records.

name: Comadre "Comadre" LP VIT028 Preorder Dec 1 (Midnight Nov 30)
description: Alright, this beast is coming into fruition. Available to preorder on Dec 1 (Nov 30th Midnight), these things are coming through in a thick gatefold with a nice 12" x 12" booklet, and 180 g vinyl. 12 new songs from Comadre, who have not released a proper full length since 2006 (although have been quite busy with a slew of other releases.) This new LP contains the song "Cold Rain" from the previous 7" single as well as 11 other songs pretty sure to impress people and throw some for a loop with their new found go-for-it attitude. Check this thing out.

name: Vique Martin "Simba: A Collection of Personal and Political Writings from the 90s Hardcore Scene"
description:
Simba Zine started in 1992 as a traditional zine and morphed into one of the most popular and well-respected "emo" zines of the 90's hardcore scene. This a comprehensive collection of the personal and political writings from the 7 years Simba zine was published, plus 5 years of columns and articles from HeartAttack, Fracture, and Clamor Magazines. All personal writings are political and revolutionary in their own right. Challenging gender roles, rules, and assumptions about sex, friendship, and love, never afraid to discuss something "too personal", these writings challenged the way people thought and behaved. Simba crossed the boundaries between the hardcore and riot grrl scenes and was undoubtedly one of the most influential zines in the 90s. 

-Roughly 260 pages, perfect bound paperback. Release date October 16. 
-Preorder shirt packages available, one of two shirts pictured below. Sizing available sm-xl on American Apparel shirts. Shirt packages are $20. 
-Intl Orders will be shipped in an International Flat rate Priority mail envelope. 
-Part of the new Vitriol Literary Series

name: DANGERS S/T 7" VIT030 Preorders Dec 1
description:
Originally released in 2005 this 7" garnered some face punchings and much shit talking. Check it out. 600 press. 

Will be available for order on October 1 with Comadre "Cold Rain" 7"

name: Moxiebeat 12" Picturedisc EP VIT031
description:
This is the first release from this desert wasteland group introducing four tracks and 11-plus minutes of explosive, kinetic bedlam. Noisy, rhythmic, dark, and appealingly off, this debut EP is something that could only make sense for a one-sided petroleum picture disc—making it appropriately designed for lazy jerks that hate turning over records.  Featuring dead members of Dogs of Ire, Rogue State and Restrained.   

“ A palm tree on fire for every tapped wire, there’s a cage for black and brown.”

 Comes with a poster and two sided picture disc image by Fritz, as well as a lyric sheet. These are out of 500 and a split between Vitriol and Ethospine Noise. Raw.

name: Kevin Stewart-Panko/Justin Smith "Do You Have Anything to Declare?" Book VIT032
description:
260 pages
(Vitriol Literary – VIT032)
5.5"x8.5"

Ask any touring band what the worst part about touring is and everything from dealing with sketchy promoters, ridiculous gas prices and long drives to the shitty pay, shittier food and lack of clean places to actually take a shit will always fall a distant second place behind crossing borders. Every band that has to deal with doing so wishes they didn't have to deal with doing so. However, it's a necessary evil and, if nothing else, it’s a source of highly entertaining tales for ambitious wannabe authors to mine, compile and exploit. 
In Do You Have Anything to Declare?, veteran music journalist/borderline hack, Kevin Stewart-Panko and Vitriol Records head honcho/rent-a-guitarist, Justin Smith interview 75 touring bands and musicians about their frustrating, terrifying, hilarious and ridiculous border crossing (mis)adventures. Compiling stories and experiences from the likes of the Dillinger Escape Plan and Fear Factory to Atheist and Zoroaster to old-school road warriors Tomas Lindberg (At the Gates/Disfear/etc.), Eugene Robinson (Oxbow) and Rich Hoak (Brutal Truth) and many more, Do You Have Anything to Declare? uses first-person accounts to shine a light on the always nail-biting experience of crossing borders around the world while on tour. Also included are the author's personal road-dogging recollections, including Smith being arrested in Denmark and Stewart-Panko, theoretically, being denied entry into his own home and native land. 
Over the course of 260 pages, topics such as drug dogs, touring through the Schengen Zone, draconian America, Eastern European searches, Russian shakedowns and the ongoing confusion and difficulty inherently associated when crossing from the U.S. into Canada are touched upon. Throw in a bit of snarky commentary, contextual context and even a few history lessons in international relations and first-time authors Stewart-Panko and Smith will have you laughing, crying, perplexed and shaking your head, wondering why any band would even bother to try and leave their home country, but grateful that they put up with as much crap as they do in order to bring their music to the people.

This is the fourth Vitriol Literary Release. 
This thing is pretty cool. Support the desire to learn things not from T.V. or declining school systems. 
These will be mailed in the next week and a half.

name: ADULT BOOKS S/T 7" VIT033
description: Alright, it has been a minute coming up this is finally here, the Adult Books 7", 4 songs of power-poppy, Ramonesy, Marked Menish radicality. Coming from a different angle than their Los Angeles rock and roll contemporaries in that they can actually tune their guitars, play their instruments, and write killer songs, this three piece has been playing around for some time and shares one member with Children of God. Check this out, 400 press.

name: HIGH WATER S/T LP VIT034
description: This is the debut LP from High Water featuring Neal from Ghostlimb and Forming on guitar and vocals. This LP is 12 songs with sound that sits somewhere between 90s guitar-centric rock and whiskey soaked awesomeness; a mix of Replacements, Archers of Loaf, and the good parts of Lucero. Lots of riffage going on here, and true to form, it is coupled with insights about theory and developmental concerns aplenty. Check this shit out, good things to come. You can peep these jams below: VIT034

name: LOST LANDS "BODY OF HABIT" 7" VIT035
description: This 4 song rager is the first release of L.A.'s Lost Lands, featuring members of every band ever, this one takes the rage of low scandanavian hardcore and goes there with a requisite roundness of melody and abrasion. Has a sweet die-cut cover, a la crunchwrap supreme, and is available in gold, blue, or black. shay guitar eagle drums justin vocals bruce bass Peep the songs here:

name: Dangers 5'OClock Shadows at the Edge of the Western World 7"(VIT038)
description: DANGERS has existed since 2005. They have released one demo tape, one self-titled vinyl EP, and two LPs/CDs, one entitled Anger and the other entitled Messy, Isn't It? The band flails amidst the murkier Southern Californian estuaries between punk, hardcore, and rock and roll, and feel most comfortable clinging to broader genre labels like "loud" or "disgruntled." They have toured extensively both domestically and overseas, and make ample use of the DIY ethic that actively destroys the performative distinction between author and audience. 2014's Five O'Clock Shadows at the Edge of the Western World finds DANGERS stretching into new musical territory that wrestles with the band's geographic, political, and emotional malaise. This new material catches the band in a moment of exhaustion with the conventions of the scene they've germinated within, searching for a more brutal(ly honest) way of communicating the peaks and valleys they have come to inhabit. US tour dates coming soon

name: Vitriol Patches
description:
Two new patches with differing logos, free shipping with any purchase of something else. Although it is often difficult to express anything sincerely (having painted myself into an asshole corner), all support is wildly appreciated. 

Grey ink on black canvas. 
dimensions approx. 5"x5" and 6.5"x2"
You get both patches for $1

thanks!

name: Graf Orlock Assorted Patches $1 back again!
description:
Get one of these fuckers to go on your messenger bag, school boy hat, or ridiculously ill fitting onesy. Pick any of these patches and it is a good chance i will send it to you. I would prefer these be ordered with something else, otherwise I will keep your measily dollar and buy a quarter of a gallon of gas. 

That being said, you have the option of any one of these super hip and cool patches which will inevitably end up in some landfill somewhere anyways.

name: Various 1" Pins $1
description: Here is a mess of label related pins, gorlock, ghostlimb, dangers, buyer's remorse etc. I won't ship these by themselves, they have to be ordered with other stuff, otherwise i will just flush them down the toilet. Anyways, enjoy.

options.name: Graf Orlock Belles Beach Point Break
Vitriol Harvard Mocking F U Pin

name: Ghostlimb assorted patches $1
description: These are some sweet patches from the Winter Tour. Do it up $1 each

name: Death Hymn Number 9 "Satanic Underlord" Shirt
description:
You like being clothed right? or are you one of those weird new age nudists? If you are the former as opposed to the latter, why not cover yourself in the finest of belogoed garment. Get this shirt and be the coolest kid in your junior high punk crew who refuse to change their pants. 

-Ships everywhere. 
-LP 3rd Degree Moonburns out in May on Alternative Tentacles.

name: Vitriol Records Logo Shirt $9
description: print of your favorite trashcan garbage label square logo white on black shirt. Wear to bother neighbors and confuse hip-hop classmates.

name: Ghostlimb Winter Tour Shirt $10
description: These shirts were made for the tour that just ended on the east coast, to avoid perplexing and embarrassing cancellations, only our fair country's  states are noted on the back. In all well planned bliss, no shows were missed so this is actually an accurate historical depiction of the tour full of shows you probably didnt attend. Pretty sweet though, check it out.

name: Ghostlimb "S/T+Bearing & Distance" LP Repress in One
description:
This is the repress on one LP of the first two ghostlimb records, "Ghostlimb" and "Bearing & Distance", nice lyric poster layout and each record cover on each side, this is a nice compliment to the new record "Infrastructure". Some of these are brown and others a black. Excited to have these back on vinyl and available. 

From Adagio830 in Germany:
"fter both Ghostlimb records have been out of print for a while and the band still keeps it strong - we decided to repress both records on one LP - all songs are remastered and feature the artwork of both records and have big poster insert.

Shit looks and sounds real good, dog. 

So you get both 12" of t his powerful three piece from LosAngeles. Ghostlimb deliver powerful solid in your face hardcore w/ a melodic edic age that reminds sometimes on Born Against. They are fast and angry and they want to give you a kick in your ass so you start to think about stuff again and not just care about boring stuff like friendship. If you care – Ghostlimb features Justin from Graf Orlock and two other rad kids that have their heart in the right place."

name: Graf Orlock DTT Poster
description:
"Cool" poster for the Destination Time Today Record. If you weren't sleeping the last 6 months away, you might have gotten this with the preorder, but i doubt you did that because you are reading this now. 

1 11x17 poster

name: Graf Orlock - Simon Phoenix "Life Iz Hell" Shirt ON SALE $5! one left!
description: This nice tee contains the felon Simon Phoenix in top form, ridding the world of loser ninnies in a no-holds-barred murder/death/kill. One could assume he is attempting to gain access to food stores to feed the homeless, or breaking into Chase bank to erase credit debt, but probably not. Doesn't look like these things will happen soon so life will continue to hellishly plod on, and the future of San Angeles is freakishly unclear.

name: Graf Orlock- "Locs" Shirt
description: Get your very own Tales from the Hood accompaniment shirt to prove your legit nature and general hard attitude. Goes perfectly with a constructed Doombox on shoulder in front of your local suburban liquor store or 7-11.

name: Protestant "Judgements" LP
description: Protestant appear to have dropped some of their sludgy, crawling, slower hues and now seem fully committed to more melodic but still urgent, contemporary passionate hardcore and they are fucking good at it. With bands like Killing the Dream, Passion and Ghostlimb (who incidentally have also just released their latest album on vinyl) coming to mind, this LP is simply chock full of driving, emotion fueled power chords and slick, addictive melodies. Every note on this 26-minute release drips with passion, intensity and sheer hardcore grace. However the track that starts side B, “Funerals” is simply goose bump inducing, awe inspiring hardcore perfection. But the likes of the fierce opener “Revenge”, somber “Deserted”, driving “Waste” and introspective closer ”Retirement” left me equally drained and not understanding why there isn't much more critical praise and recognition for this hard working people. Pissed, melodic, good songs. Check this out if you haven't already.

name: (Young) Pioneers "On Trial" 7"
description:
Great band with ideas. Distortion, guitars, drums, more distortion, awesome songs. This isn't for everyone, but it definitely rules if you get a chance to check it out.  5 songs. One of my favorite bands in the 90s. Don't relate them for Defiance Ohio or This Bike is a pipebomb please. 

From the internet: (Young) Pioneers was an American folk punk band from Richmond, Virginia active from 1993 to 1999. Composed of members of such influential bands as Born Against, Avail and Ted Leo and the Pharmacists, they released two albums and numerous singles on Vermiform and Lookout! Records. An overtly political band, their lyrics ranged from "superfluous nods to radical heroes like George Jackson and Carlos the Jackal" to "describ[ing] the relationship between struggling individuals and the machinery of oppressive politics"

1. Pioneer Worker Pact
2. (At The Time Of The) Cease Fire
3. Regrets Of The Doubters
4. Fuck The Labor Pool
5. Paralyzed Veteran

name: MNMNTS "The Choir Belongs to You" LP
description:
Three new epic long songs by our best buddies MNMNTS - the new songs got recorded with a new singer and they going further in the direction of catchiness. The new songs are raw and melodic and will stuck in your head for days. 

The record comes w/ screenprinted jackets by Pressure Ink w/ die cut sleeve and a screen printed B-Side by Black Ink - And we got another great design job by Druckwelle

Listen here - http://mnmntspunk.bandcamp.com/album/the-choir-belongs-to-you

name: Trees "Sickness In" Lp
description: 'Sickness In' is the third album from Portland's most wretched, Trees. The band presents a two-song assault, each one roughly fifteen minutes in length, each a slowly rotting heap of droning slow-motion deathdoom riffs decomposing into clouds of black amplifier hum, high shrieking voices and tortured screams drifting against the glacial roar of smoking amp stacks and short-circuiting hardware. Where the previous album had Trees employing some interesting rhythmic chaos and longer stretches of ambient filth, this time around the band drops some of their most leaden, majestic riffs yet into their slow-mo filthstorm, massive saurian doom riffs slipping WAY out of the confines of 'groove' and deep into rumbling fields of charred ritualistic chanting and almost Abruptum-like states of psychotic noise.

name: the Saddest Landscape "Lift Your Burdens High For this is Where We Cross" LP
description: Tan vinyl. Also includes a printed inner sleeves with in depth liner notes. Limited to 375 copies. This is their second LP, reissued in a deluxe gatefold cover, updated artwork, metal foil printing, commentary, lyrics, and a bonus CD version.

name: Amanda Woodward "La Decadence De La Decadence" CD $4
description: Amanda Woodward, now members in the band Aussitot Mort. Get on this if this is your style. Euro emotive jams. Only a couple of these left, son (or daughter).

name: the Saddest Landscape "The Sound of the Spectacle" LP
description:
deluxe reissue of their first LP, with updated artwork, commentary, lyrics, gatefold cover , a bonus CD version, and it also includes the euro only bonus track not originally on the first press of the record.

**this is for the opaque blue vinyl pressing.

name: Ash Borer "Demo" LP
description:
this is ASH BORER'S 2009 demo, remixed and mastered at mammoth sound studios
comes with a letterpressed / silkscreened cover

demo review from sputnik: "Ash Borer's brand of atmospheric black metal, or as it's being called "Cascadian black metal" is absolutely incredible.

Might as well start off with the most important aspect of this album and that's definitely the instruments.The guitar riffs and tremolo picking definitely have the biggest effect on this demo. They are used to create one hell of an atmosphere. When you hear some of the riffs on this album, they're going to put you in a trance like state. Now with only two songs on this album, the first being about 14 minutes and the second being about 11, you're going to hear the riffs repeated plenty of times. Now for some black metal bands repetitiveness can be bad, well that's not the case with Ash Borer. The riffs are extremely catchy and will stick in your head long after you listen to this album. Drumming is pretty standard for a black metal album. Now with atmospheric black metal you should know that it's all about atmosphere (obviously). The drums aren't really meant to stand out over the guitars and they really don't, but it's not like it's the same beat over and over. There's enough variety in the drumming to keep the listener entertained for the whole 25 minutes of the demo. Fast and slow parts are present on the album and the drums vary with that.

name: Terrorbird "Secret Rituals" LP
description:
This is the 2nd full length by terror bird from vancouver, Canada. The records contains also Terror Bird‘s “She Kissed Me (and I Fell Ill)” originally which appeared on sold out Waiting For Nothing 7″ inch that was released by London’s Verulamium Records roughly a year ago, only a couple of weeks after Night-People & adagio830 released the Vancouver outfit’s debut full-length Human Culture.

Terror Bird’s sophomore record Secret Rituals 9 perfect dark pop songs 

peep a song here:
http://www.adagio830.de/news/terror-bird-secret-rituals-lp-pre-order/

name: Dangers Stickers (3) $1.50
description: Here are some stickers you might like to stick on things, like your trapper keeper, your skateboard, or your rollerblades. These aren't papery, so they should last at least until you get out of continuation school or slip past the officials in high school. Anyways, good luck on all accounts, be seeing you in county, probably.

name: (Young) Pioneers "Free the (Young) Pioneers Now!" LP
description:
This is the last record of the (Young) Pioneers which came out sometime in 99, the most cohesive and well recorded one they did, excellent, and somehow in part responsible for the miserable genre of folk-punk (in a much degraded 15th generation quality after them).

From the ill informed interwebs:
The (Young) Pioneers from Richmond, VA, fire up ragged blasts of blues-infused punk rock on their heroic-sounding record Free the (Young) Pioneers Now!, which combines Civil War imagery and Southern politics with raging punk numbers equipped with handclaps, a harmonica, sax, and organ. There are two great covers, the Impression's "Meeting Over Yonder" and Impatient Youth's "Praise the Lord and Pass the Ammunition." More artful than singer/guitarist Adam Payson's last band, the straight-up hardcore Born Against, The (Young) Pioneers stand out from their punk rock brethren by adding some genuine boogie and soul to their unruly, radical sound. 

14 songs. Get this

name: Reivers "Sympathetic Shock" LP
description: This is Reivers first proper full length after the 7" Schemata came out on Vitriol last year. Put out by our German friends at Vendetta. Female fronted pissed rocky-hardcore. Shut up.

name: Ruined Families "Blank Language" LP
description:
After their debut LP and their great 7″ from last year – Ruined Families from Athens / greece take another step forward to push themself into a new direction. From the chaotic fast Hardcore they got more and more complex and dark. Mixing up their fast pissed of hardcore with post punk elements and intense song writing. 9 songs of blistering hardcore …

you can stream the whole record here

http://www.cvltnation.com/ruined-families/

name: Kids of Zoo Debut LP
description: Noisy Garage Rock, out on Adagio 830 check

name: Lake of Blood "As Time and Tide Erodes Stone" LP
description: Two dirgy ass black metal song from lovable So. Cal burnouts. This record has two long playing BM songs to ruin your psyche and other easily destroyed ephemera.

name: Deadverse "Caution to the Wind" LP
description:
After two self-released EPs and a self-released split-CD with Unveil, Switzerland’s DEADVERSE finally recorded eleven passionate and emotive songs for the band’s debut album.
 
“Caution To The Wind” could be best described as a mix of Midwestern emo, Revolution Summer hardcore à la Gray Matter or Rites of Spring, Dackelblut, and even some Engine Down thrown in. Good.

name: Locktender/Brighter Arrows Split 10"
description: Solid people from cleveland (Locktender) check this out here

name: Lich/Resurrectionists Split LP
description: Finally new tunes by the Resurrectionists and the first recorings of Lich, containing Battle of Wolf 359 members, after their demorecordings. Expect one of the brutalist splits of this year. Check this out if you liked the Battle of the Wolf 359/Resurrectionists 10" split.

name: Counterblast "Faceless" 10"
description: Finally, 2 new songs (20 minutes) from those amazing swedes. Ultra intense, dark crust punk in the vein of Neurosis. Passionate and apocalyptic. The first new release  in several years. Monumental crust from Sweden with a very unique style that blends elements of crust, metal and somewhat ambient, eerie and tribal sounding music together.  Released on Alerta Antifascista Records, Germany.

name: Maladie - Full Length CD
description: These badasses from Tijuana bring you some pretty pissed songs in their new full length cd. Fast, mad, and melodic as shit, these dudes bring it. So check it out, or forever be an idiot for sleeping on them. 11  Songs to hurt your baby brain.

name: Giant "They The Undeserving" CD
description: First Lp from this post rock band from Iowa. Check it out

name: Death Hymn Number 9 "Smokestack Frightening" LP
description: Moron rock and roll with stompy, bluesy, lo-fi, and straight up asshole-y parts. First lp on green vinyl. Keep eyes open for new record coming soon "Third Degree Moonburns"

name: Zann/Burial Year Split LP
description:
BURIAL YEAR (RIP) from San Francisco offer the final recordings including a UNBROKEN cover song. Burial Year has been the follow up band of bands like TAKARU & A LIGHT IN THE ATTIC.  Burial Year play once again metallic brutal hardcore like the did w/ Takaru. The recordings kill everything. ZANN have one new pretty long tune and an a CHOKEHOLD cover. They got stoked in the mid90ies mosh hardcore. So what do you expect..

-On Adagio 830 Records
-Tight gatefold layout

name: Little Gold "On the Knife" LP
description: Christian DeRoeck spent most of the past decade writing, touring & recording with the Brooklyn indie/punk band Meneguar. In late 2006, He and bandmate Jeremy Earl decided to combine their bedroom recordings and release them together, as Woods. They recorded two albums together and toured the US and Europe. In early 2008, for several reasons, Christian left both bands. On the Knife is a deeply personal take on love and loss, and was very much shaped by Christian’s departure from his previous bands. Like his earlier work with Woods, the songwriting is earnest, and of course there are a few indulgent headphone tracks as well.
